summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, including a court appearance and attorney visits, and the subsequent discovery of him unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, leading to resuscitation attempts, transport to the hospital, and official notifications.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the timeline, found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of the incident at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The warden of the correctional institution who was notified of the incident, arrived at the institution, and later notified the Office of the Inspector General (OIG).

connections.description: Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case, as evidenced by his notification of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day in Court
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein departs for court in the morning, spends the day in attorney conferences, and returns to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) in the evening. He is reported to be in good spirits during a social call.

events.title: Discovery of Unresponsive Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated in the SHU. Staff find inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated, medical staff and EMS respond, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital.

events.title: Official Notifications and Investigation Launch
events.description: Following the incident, a series of officials are notified including the USMS, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and the OIG. The FBI and OIG arrive at the institution to investigate. Epstein's next of kin (brother) is notified.

events.title: Body Released for Autopsy
events.description: At 12:15 pm, Epstein's body is released to the Medical Examiner (ME) for an autopsy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) / The Institution (implied location of SHU)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
Despite immediate CPR and advanced life support by on-site medical staff and EMS, Epstein remained unresponsive and was transported to Beekman Hospital where he was later pronounced dead.
Multiple agencies were rapidly notified and involved, including the FBI, USMS, AUSA, and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), indicating the high-profile nature of the incident.
Epstein's cellmate was released from court on August 9 and did not return to the institution, leaving Epstein alone in the cell on the night before his death.
A desktop computer was removed from the SHU and secured for investigation by the OIG on the evening of August 10.
